text.p: Barrick Gold Corp said on Friday that it has appointed John Carrington as president and chief operating officer of the company.
Carringotn also becomes a member of the board of directors, Barrick said in a statement.
Bob Smith, who has been president since 1987, becomes vice-chairman and will focus on Barrick's development strategy.
Carrington was responsible for integrating the mines acquired from Lac Minerals Ltd into Barrick's operations, chief executive Peter Munk said in the statement.
"He has also focused our attention on the importance of innovative thinking at our mines, and increased operating efficiency," Munk said.
Carrington, 53, will be responsible for Barrick's mining operations and the overall management of the company's direction.
He joined Barrick in January 1995 as executive vice-president of operations. He was made chief operating officer in January 1996.
Smith is leaving the president role because he wanted to spend less time in the office, Barrick spokesman Vince Borg said in a statement.
"He's decided to take a less onerous role and focus on development strategy," Borg explained.
